statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Fordham 83, La Salle 74
article.story: NEW YORK (AP) -- Corey McCrae made all six of his 3-point attempts and shot 7-for-8 from the foul line for a career-high 25 points as Fordham snapped a four-game losing streak with an 83-74 upset victory over La Salle on Wednesday night. Bryant Dunston added 20 points and Jermaine Anderson 14 for the Rams (13-15, 8-7 Atlantic 10). Steve Smith scored 21 points on 14-of-26 shooting from the field for the Explorers (17-9, 9-6), who lost their second straight after winning their previous seven. Jermaine Thomas added 17 points and Darnell Harris had 11. Thomas made three 3-pointers as La Salle, which trailed 47-36 at halftime, opened the second half on a 13-3 run to close to within one at 50-49 with 15:33 remaining. The Rams then scored eight unanswered points on 3-pointers by Marcus Stout and McCrae, and a jumper by Dunston to make it 58-49 at 12:39. A pair of free throws by McCraw with 9:06 left in the game made it 67-54, and the Explorers never got closer than seven. Smith's layup at 10:19 of the opening half gave La Salle its last lead at 16-14. Dunston then scored seven points and Anderson had five in a 20-7 run that gave the Rams a 36-21 edge with 4:11 remaining. Dunston's jumper closed out the stretch that produced the biggest lead of the half.
